title: Magnus Carlsen meltdown: Pieces fly off the board as D Gukesh shocks World No. 1
content: In a stunning upset at Norway Chess, D Gukesh defeated Magnus Carlsen for the first time in a classical game, marking a historic moment. Carlsen's blunder under time pressure led to a dramatic win for the Indian champion. Gukesh's victory is a morale-booster, placing him among the few Indians to achieve this feat against Carlsen as world No. 1.

title: 'Look at the attitude!': HC to Kamal Haasan over Kannada remark, says 'just apologise'
content: The Karnataka High Court questioned Kamal Haasan regarding his remarks about the Kannada language's origin, during a hearing about his film 'Thug Life' ban. Justice Nagaprasanna drew parallels to a past apology from C Rajagopalachari for similar comments. The court emphasized that freedom of expression doesn't justify hurting sentiments related to language and land.

title: ‘Give your best offers by…’: Trump admin pushes countries to urgently finalise trade deals
content: The Trump administration is pushing for swift trade deal conclusions, urging nations to submit optimal proposals. This urgency follows initial tariff suspensions and market reactions. While a preliminary agreement exists with Britain, the U.S. seeks comprehensive offers on tariffs, quotas, digital commerce, and economic security from partners like the EU, Japan, Vietnam, and India.

title: 'What if China stops Brahmaputra water?': Assam CM shuts down 'Pak's scare narrative'
content: Assam's Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma refuted Pakistan's claims about China potentially weaponizing the Brahmaputra River. Sarma clarified that the Brahmaputra is primarily fed by Indian monsoon rains, with China contributing only a smaller portion of its flow. He dismissed the concerns as fear-mongering, highlighting India's dominant role in sustaining the river's volume and asserting its water sovereignty.

title: 'Ee Sala Cup Namde': Drake bets $750,000 on RCB to win IPL 2025 final
content: Drake, the Canadian rap sensation, has placed a staggering $750,000 bet on Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) to win their first IPL title against Punjab Kings. The high-stakes wager, made through Stake, could potentially earn him over $1.3 million if RCB, fueled by Virat Kohli's impressive form, secure victory in the highly anticipated final at Narendra Modi Stadium.

title: Anand Mahindra on Carlsen’s reaction after losing to D Gukesh: ‘Wasn’t just a…’
content: D Gukesh, the youngest World Chess Champion, defeated Magnus Carlsen at the Norway Chess tournament, earning praise from Anand Mahindra. Gukesh's composed victory contrasted with Carlsen's frustration, marking a milestone in his career with his first classical win against the world champion. He now stands third in the tournament, closely trailing Carlsen and Caruana.

title: 'India buying arms from Russia rubbed US the wrong way., but ... ': Trump admin
content: US Commerce Secretary stated that India's shift towards purchasing US military equipment is fostering a stronger trade relationship, potentially leading to a bilateral trade agreement soon. He highlighted that India's previous reliance on Russian arms had strained ties. Both nations aim to finalize the initial phase of a trade deal by late 2025, targeting $500 billion in bilateral trade.

title: IPL match today, PBKS vs RCB: All you need to know about the final
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Punjab Kings are set to clash in the IPL 2025 final, both seeking a historic win. RCB aims to break their title drought, while PBKS seeks their first title since 2014. The Ahmedabad pitch favors batting, and warm, slightly muggy conditions are expected for the evening match.

title: Stock market: Nifty50 goes below 24,550; BSE Sensex tanks over 700 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, were volatile in trade on Tuesday. While Nifty50 went below 24,550, BSE Sensex sank over 700 points.

title: When Google's former CEO suggested US Army to give away tanks, and buy ...
content: In June 2025, Ukraine launched Operation Spiderweb, a large-scale drone offensive targeting Russian air bases, showcasing the increasing importance of drones in modern warfare. Eric Schmidt, former Google CEO, advocates for AI-driven defense solutions, developing "Kamikaze drones" for Ukraine through his startup, White Stork. These drones aim to neutralize high-value targets, signaling a shift towards autonomous technology in military strategies.

title: NEET UG answer key 2025 released: Submit challenges online by this date
content: National Testing Agency has released the provisional answer key for NEET UG 2025. Candidates can download it from neet.nta.nic.in. The answer key challenge window is open from June 3 to June 5, 2025. Candidates can submit challenges online. NTA will prepare final answer keys based on these challenges. NEET UG results are expected by June 14, 2025.

title: 19-yr-old killed by ‘boyfriend’ for 'talking to another man’; stabbed over 40 times
content: A 19-year-old woman was discovered murdered in a Moradabad farm on Sunday, having been missing since Saturday evening. Police reported over 40 stab wounds on her body, indicating she was also strangled.

title: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis: If I were a student right now, I would study ...
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis advises students to prioritize STEM subjects and embrace AI tools for future job market success. Speaking at SXSW London, he emphasized the importance of understanding mathematical and scientific fundamentals. Hassabis predicts AI will create valuable jobs for technically skilled individuals, urging students to gain hands-on experience with AI systems.

title: IPL Final, RCB vs PBKS: Mood in Ahmedabad completely dry ahead of title decider
content: Ahmedabad's mood ahead of the IPL 2025 final between RCB and PBKS is unexpectedly subdued, with low fan turnout and sluggish merchandise sales. Despite star power and high stakes, the city lacks buzz. Rain remains a threat but excitement lingers as fans await a new champion. Will it be Rajat Patidar’s RCB or Shreyas Iyer’s Punjab Kings?

title: Woman falls at Bengaluru auto driver’s feet to apologise after thrashing him with slippers
content: A software engineer, Pankhuri Mishra, and her husband publicly apologized to an autorickshaw driver after she assaulted him following a near-collision in Bengaluru. The incident, triggered by her concern for her pregnancy during sudden braking, led to her arrest and subsequent bail.

title: Will we get to see a Tharoor vs Bhutto? India and Pak delegations to be in US same day
content: An Indian all-party delegation, led by Shashi Tharoor, is set to visit Washington, DC, coinciding with a Pakistani delegation headed by Bilawal Bhutto-Zardari. Tharoor anticipates increased interest due to the presence of both delegations presenting opposing views on India-Pakistan relations. He is confident that the Indian delegation will effectively convey its message despite the crowded media landscape.

title: IPL 2025 final, RCB vs PBKS: A new champion will be crowned today
content: Virat Kohli's quest for an elusive IPL title with Royal Challengers Bengaluru takes center stage as they face a Shreyas Iyer-led Punjab Kings in the final. While Kohli aims to complete his trophy cabinet, PBKS seeks their maiden title. The match promises a thrilling contest between two evenly matched teams, with the team holding their nerve likely to emerge victorious.

title: 'Aap hi ko copy kiya': Khan Sir's wedding banter with Tejashwi Yadav goes viral
content: Educator Khan Sir celebrated his marriage with a grand reception in Patna, attended by prominent Bihar politicians. He revealed the wedding was a private affair due to India-Pakistan tensions, mirroring Tejashwi Yadav's secret marriage. Khan Sir shared the news with his students first, acknowledging their importance, and plans a special feast for them as a gesture of gratitude.

title: Zelenskyy says Ukraine’s drone strikes will continue until Russia halts offensive
content: President Zelenskyy affirmed Ukraine's successful drone attack on Russia, warning of continued strikes unless Moscow ceases its offensive. Speaking after US-brokered peace talks in Istanbul, he highlighted the drone strike as a strategic operation. Both sides agreed to exchange wounded prisoners and discussed a potential meeting between Zelenskyy and Putin, while Russia rejected Ukraine's ceasefire proposal.

title: 'I am very compassionate': Joni Ernst defends her 'we all are going to die' remark
content: Senator Joni Ernst defended her "we all are going to die" statement made at a heated town hall regarding a GOP-backed domestic policy bill. The bill, named the One Big Beautiful Bill act, proposes work requirements for some Medicaid recipients, sparking criticism and accusations of contempt from constituents and potential electoral challengers.

title: Rajat Patidar's captaincy saga: From self-doubt to brink of immortality
content: Rajat Patidar stands on the cusp of IPL glory, leading RCB in their quest to end an 18-year title drought against PBKS. Despite initial self-doubt, Patidar's captaincy has transformed RCB, marked by dominant performances. KKR coach Chandrakant Pandit highlights Patidar's rapid learning and mental fortitude, evident in his leadership of Madhya Pradesh and his proactive approach to improvement.

title: 'We are not looking for war': Shashi Tharoor says Brazil backs India's anti-terror stance against Pakistan
content: Shashi Tharoor, leading an all-party delegation in Brazil, conveyed India's firm stance against cross-border terrorism following the Pahalgam attack and Operation Sindoor. Brazil expressed solidarity, condemning terrorism against Indian civilians. Tharoor emphasized India's calibrated response, seeking global understanding for its counter-terrorism strategy. The delegation engaged with Brazilian officials and the India-Brazil Friendship Front, reinforcing cooperation and addressing India's security concerns.

title: Pak spy arrested for sharing sensitive info to ISI during Op Sindoor
content: Tarn Taran Police, in collaboration with Counter-Intelligence-Punjab, arrested Gagandeep Singh for allegedly sharing sensitive information with Pakistan's ISI and Gopal Singh Chawla. He is accused of leaking classified details about army movements during Operation Sindoor, posing a national security threat. Investigations revealed a five-year connection with Chawla and Pakistani Intelligence Operatives, involving financial transactions through Indian channels.

title: Pakistan's Punjab speaker backs Pahalgam attacker at rally
content: A Pakistani Punjab assembly speaker, Malik Ahmed Khan, has sparked controversy by publicly supporting Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) deputy chief Saifullah Kasuri, a US-designated terrorist linked to the Pahalgam attack. Khan defended Kasuri at a rally, dismissing accusations pending investigation.

title: Elon Musk’s father Errol Musk to visit Ram Temple in Ayodhya on June 4
content: Errol Musk, father of Elon Musk, is scheduled to visit the Ram temple in Ayodhya on June 4. He is likely to be treated as a state guest by the Uttar Pradesh government. This visit is part of his five-day trip to India, during which he will also attend business meetings.

title: Assam floods worsen, over 5 lakh affected, death toll touches 36 in Northeast
content: The flood situation in Northeast India has worsened, affecting over 5.15 lakh people in Assam alone, with the death toll climbing to 36. Heavy rainfall warnings persist for several states, as the Brahmaputra and Barak rivers flow above danger levels. Relief efforts are underway, and authorities are evacuating affected populations in Manipur and Mizoram.

title: 'One more to go ...': Preity Zinta's special post for 'Sarpanch' Shreyas Iyer
content: Preity Zinta, co-owner of Punjab Kings, expressed her excitement and support as the team reached the IPL 2025 final. She praised Shreyas Iyer's leadership, the coaching staff, and key players for their contributions. Zinta's message reflects the team's collective spirit and the fans' hopes as Punjab Kings aim for their first IPL title against Royal Challengers Bengaluru.

title: Gold price prediction: Where are gold rates headed today & in the near-term?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are experiencing volatility due to US-China trade tensions and geopolitical concerns. Recent US data indicates manufacturing contraction and declining import/export gauges.

title: 'Itna gaali khate hain ... ': Shreyas Iyer's old video with Rohit Sharma goes viral
content: Ahead of the IPL 2025 final between Punjab Kings and Royal Challengers Bengaluru, PBKS captain Shreyas Iyer's candid comments on 'The Great Indian Kapil Show' have gone viral. Iyer jokingly confessed his joy in dismissing senior Indian team players, particularly Rohit Sharma, during IPL matches.

title: US-India trade deal expected 'in not too distant future': US commerce secretary
content: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick anticipates a swift trade agreement between the US and India, crediting the strong relationship between President Trump and Prime Minister Modi. He emphasized the desire for increased market access for US businesses in India.

title: 'On normal day I win that game': Magnus Carlsen on loss to D Gukesh
content: Magnus Carlsen faced a shocking defeat against 19-year-old Indian Grandmaster D Gukesh at the Norway Chess tournament, triggering visible frustration. Carlsen acknowledged Gukesh's fighting spirit and youthful energy as decisive factors. Following the loss, Carlsen rebounded with an Armageddon win over Hikaru Nakamura.

title: Watch: Surya’s heartwarming moment with Arshdeep’s parents melts the internet
content: Following Punjab Kings' victory over Mumbai Indians in IPL 2025 Qualifier 2, a heartwarming moment emerged. Despite MI's defeat, Suryakumar Yadav, who had a stellar season, met and embraced Arshdeep Singh's parents. This gesture of sportsmanship, transcending team rivalries, went viral. Arshdeep now prepares for the final against Royal Challengers Bengaluru, while Suryakumar's impressive season concludes.

title: Colorado firebomb suspect planned attack on pro-Israeli protesters for a year
content: Mohammed Sabry Soliman, an Egyptian national, faces federal hate crime charges for allegedly attacking pro-Israeli protesters in Colorado. He reportedly planned the attack for a year, using Molotov cocktails and gasoline, injuring twelve. Soliman expressed no remorse and desired the victims' deaths.

title: Gnanasekaran tried to rape another student a day before crime
content: A Gnanasekaran received a life sentence for the Anna University rape case. He had previously attempted a similar assault. A university staff member intervened in the prior attempt. Crucial evidence included call records and forensic analysis. Police identified Gnanasekaran through CCTV footage and mobile data. The investigation team submitted extensive evidence. The court dismissed claims of additional involvement.

title: Kerala HC allows Transgender couple to use gender-neutral ‘parent’ in birth certificate
content: In a landmark ruling, the Kerala High Court has allowed India's first transgender parents to be identified as 'parents' on their child's birth certificate, replacing the traditional 'father' and 'mother' designations. Justice A A Ziyad Rahman's order came after Zahhad, a trans man who gave birth, and Ziya Paval petitioned the court.

title: 'Grandfather category': Usha Vance recalls how her kids bonded with PM Modi
content: Usha Vance, wife of US Vice President JD Vance, expressed admiration for Prime Minister Narendra Modi's hospitality following their family's visit to India in April. She highlighted the special meeting with PM Modi, noting her children's instant affection for him, further solidified by a thoughtful birthday gift.

title: Buy or sell: Stock market recommendations for today
content: Stock market recommendations: Mirae Asset Sharekhan suggests buying Hudco and Indian Hotels. Hudco, trading between Rs 246 and Rs 250, aims for a target of Rs 280, supported by positive momentum indicators and breaking out of consolidation. Indian Hotels, priced between Rs 780 and Rs 790, targets Rs 835, driven by a bullish flag pattern breakout and support at its 20-day moving average.

title: 'Bas jeetna hai': Shreyas Iyer's mother's heartfelt wish ahead of IPL final
content: The IPL final is set as Punjab Kings and Royal Challengers Bengaluru, both seeking their first title, clash in Ahmedabad. PBKS, led by talismanic captain Shreyas Iyer, returns to the final after a decade. An emotional video message from Iyer's family, filled with Punjabi spirit, has boosted the team's morale.

title: 6.2 magnitude earthquake hits Greece, tremors felt in Turkey
content: A 6.2 magnitude earthquake struck the Dodecanese Islands in Greece near the Turkish border, as reported by EMSC. Simultaneously, a 5.8 magnitude earthquake hit Marmaris, Turkey, injuring seven as residents fled, according to Governor Idris Akbiyik. Centered in the Mediterranean Sea, the quake was felt in Rhodes, Greece. Turkey, prone to earthquakes, experienced a devastating 7.

title: RTE Gujarat Round 3 admissions begin: Check direct link to apply here
content: The Gujarat Education Department has launched Round 3 of RTE 2025 admissions after over 9,000 seats remained unfilled across unaided private schools, with English-medium institutions reporting the most vacancies. Only previously registered applicants without seat allotments are eligible. Admissions remain based on earlier preferences, with no new entries or edits permitted. The application window closes June 4.

title: Army duo, porter die as landslide hits Sikkim camp
content: A devastating landslide in Sikkim's Mangan district claimed the lives of two Army personnel and a porter after their camp was swept away due to heavy rainfall. Rescue operations are underway to locate six missing individuals, including an Army officer, his wife, and their daughter.

title: Indian flyers to double in 5 yrs, ambition to commercialise space flights: PM
content: PM Modi highlighted India's soaring aviation sector at IATA's AGM, projecting flyer footfall to double by 2030 and airport numbers to reach 350 by 2047. He emphasized India's ambition to become a $4 billion MRO hub and a leader in space-aviation convergence.

title: Symptoms of Vitamin D deficiency in your hair and skin
content: Even for a tropical country like ours that gets plenty of sunshine, almost 80% of the population suffers from Vitamin D deficiency. Known as the "sunshine vitamin", Vitamin D is a nutrient the body needs, along with calcium, to build bones and keep them healthy. When your body lacks enough vitamin D, it can show up in subtle but important ways, especially in your hair and skin. Here are some signs that you need some Vitamin D

title: Behind Shreyas Iyer 2.0 and WhatsApp group named 'Team Shreyas'
content: PBKS captain Shreyas Iyer's 39 sixes so far this IPL is more than that of his combined sixes in the last three seasons. The 30-year-old saw brought about marked improvements in his strike rate and batting average. Here's how a technique tailor made for him proved to be the difference.

title: India clears literacy exam with 80.9%, but gender & urban-rural gaps remain
content: The PLFS 2023-24 reveals India's overall literacy rate at 80.9% for those aged seven and above, with Mizoram leading at 98.2%. Significant disparities persist across states, gender, and urban-rural divides. Bihar, Madhya Pradesh, and Rajasthan have the lowest literacy rates, while Rajasthan exhibits the widest gender gap, highlighting the need for focused interventions in education.

title: Anna University sexual assault case: Annamalai warns of revealing identities of police officers allegedly contacted by convict
content: Several questions about Anna University sexual assault case remain unanswered, Mr. Annamalai charged.

title: Hema Committee report: No headway in probes; police decide to drop cases as survivors stay silent
content: However, investigations into around 70 cases registered based on disclosures made after Hema Committee report’s release are under way

title: Arunachal orders closure of 386 government schools for zero enrolment
content: The closure affect schools in almost every district, including remote and border regions such as Kurung Kumey, Tawang, Anjaw, Changlang and Upper Subansiri

title: Nilambur bypoll: P.V. Anvar to contest as independent after EC rejects Trinamool nomination
content: Election Commission rejects his nomination as Trinamool Congress candidate on technical grounds during scrutiny. But the commission accepts his second set of nomination as independent candidate

title: Museum of Art & Photography installations to be exhibited at Terminal 2 of Kempegowda International Airport Bengaluru
content: The Bangalore International Airport Limited (BIAL) which operates KIA, stated that this collaboration aims to transform the airport into a dynamic cultural hub

title: Minister orders probe after POCSO case accused attends school reopening event in Kerala
content: Vlogger Mukesh M. Nair was one of the guests at Praveshanotsavam held at Fort High School in Thiruvananthapuram on June 2

title: Parvathy Thiruvothu slams Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan over inaction on Hema Committee report
content: Her remarks came after it was reported that the police plan to close the remaining cases registered on the basis of statements recorded in the committee’s findings

title: Man held in Punjab for sharing sensitive information with Pakistan
content: Investigations said the accused was engaged in sharing classified details, including troop deployments and strategic locations, posing a threat to national security.

title: Angels’ World is a community living project in Thiruvananthapuram built by parents of neurodivergent children
content: Angels’ World at Mannanthala in Thiruvananthapuram has been set up by 10 sets of parents who have children on the autism spectrum

title: Over 56,000 people affected, 10,477 houses damaged in Manipur floods
content: Several localities in the State's capital Imphal, and many parts of Imphal East district have been inundated after a swollen river breached embankments and overflowed in Khurai, Heingang and Checkon areas

title: 17-year-old goes missing from Piravom in Kerala
content: The boy had gone to school in the morning when the new academic year began. However, he did not  return, and his parents lodged a police complaint.

title: MHA notifies new policies for Union Territory of Ladakh that determine domicile tag
content: The policies are introduced to provide 85% of reservation for the Scheduled Tribes (ST) in government jobs

title: How is President’s Rule imposed? | Explained
content: What does Article 356 of the Constitution stipulate? How have different Governors dealt with dissolving Legislative Assemblies after President’s Rule has been invoked? When did the Supreme Court first intervene in the decision of the Union Government to impose President’s Rule?

title: India-U.S. trade deal in ‘not too distant future’: U.S. Commerce Secretary Lutnick
content: Howard Lutnick said in his keynote address at the eighth edition of the U.S.-India Strategic Partnership Forum (USISPF) in Washington on Sunday

title: News Analysis: Ahead of polls, all eyes in Bihar on Chirag Paswan’s next political move
content: The LJP(RV) chief and party MP has said he does not see himself in national politics for long; the statements from him and his party have generated considerable interest, amid buzz that the could play a bigger role in State politics in the future

title: Ennore: Where industrial growth has made life difficult for residents
content: Residents of Ennore struggle with pollution on a day-to-day basis, but it gains widespread attention only when a major incident occurs

title: Home Minister’s remarks on West Bengal CM opposing Operation Sindoor incorrect and motivated, says TMC
content: On June 1, the Home Minister Amit Shah had accused the Trinamool Congress chairperson of opposing “Operation Sindoor” to “appease the Muslim vote bank”. In a statement the TMC said that “the CM has consistently backed national security initiatives, including Operation Sindoor”

title: Telangana govt. to develop 80-acres Eco-Town modelled on Japanese city Kitakyushu
content: The State government of Telangana will also be collaborating with Kitakyushu on several forward-looking initiatives

title: Under pressure on the battlefield, Ukraine turns to drones to hurt Russia
content: Ukraine claimed its Sunday attacks destroyed over 40 Russian warplanes, including nuclear-capable bombers; Russia says the strikes were repelled with no casualties; the attack was in the works for 18 months, says Kyiv; the strike came as both sides were preparing for peace talks in Istanbul

title: Officers close to Jharkhand CM conspiring against me, alleges BJP leader Babulal Marandi
content: JMM hit back at Mr. Marandi, saying he has made a baseless allegation for petty politics; party spokesperson Tanuj Khatri says under the visionary leadership of Hemant Soren, Jharkhand has entered a new phase of inclusive development

title: BJP takes dig at Congress ahead of Rahul Gandhi’s visit to Haryana
content: The Congress in Haryana is yet to choose its Legislature Party leader (CLP), who would serve as the Leader of Opposition in the Assembly, though it has been eight months since the new govt. was formed in the State

title: New Uttar Pradesh DGP outlines blueprint to improve policing
content: The 1991-batch Indian Police Service (IPS) officer expressed gratitude to U.P. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath for trusting him to lead the world’s largest “provincial police force

title: India to get remaining S-400 missile systems by 2026, says Russia
content: Russia also hinted at expanding bilateral cooperation with India in air defence and anti-drone systems

title: SRMIST and The Hindu to organise webinar on emerging careers
content: It will explore the growing demand for inter-disciplinary professionals in areas such as digital strategy, behavioural economics, climate policy, and UX (user experience) design

title: Devdutta Majhi from West Bengal’s Katwa secures top rank among girls in JEE (Advanced)
content: She has secured a top rank in JEE (Mains) this year, while also featuring among the Statewide top ten merit lists in the class 10 and class 12 board examinations

title: Pahalgam attack casts shadow on turnoutat Kheer Bhawani
content: With a sense of fear looming large this year post-Pahalgam attack and the four-day military confrontation between India and Pakistan, local politicians have come forward to encourage Pandits to visit the Valley temples.

title: Punjab approves new land pooling policy; Akali Dal terms it anti-farmer
content: Complete authority lies with the farmer, and it will be their decision whether to give land to the government or not; farmers can either keep their land and continue farming or choose to sell; there will be no forced acquisition

title: NHRC issues notice to Bihar government over death of minor rape victim at govt. hospital
content: It is alleged that the critically injured nine-year-old remained in an ambulance for several hours for want of bed

title: Rahul Gandhi approaches Jharkhand High Court challenging a non-bailable warrant
content: The case is related to Mr. Gandhi’s speech against Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leaders in March 2018

title: For most residents of Pakistan Tola in Bihar, the village name is an embarrassment
content: Ever since the Pahalgam attacks in April this year, people of Pakistan Tola in Bihar’s Purnia district have been demanding to change the name of the village they have been living in for years

title: Adani says it doesn't handle Iranian cargo, unaware of any U.S. probe into Iran sanctions violations
content: It went on to state that the Adani group "does not manage or facilitate any ships whose owners are Iranian. This policy is strictly adhered to across all our ports".

title: Hoardings that pose a threat to public safety yet to be removed
content: Outdoor advertisers in Kozhikode city yet to act despite SHRC directive; residents warn of serious monsoon-season risks; Corporation promises strict follow-up action within a week

title: Praveshanolsavam marks school reopening in district
content: Minister G.R. Anil inaugurates the district-level Praveshanolsavam at Government Higher Secondary School, Kavalayoor, Attingal, on Monday

title: Dam protests: NHRC issues notice to Arunachal government
content: According to the reports, on May 23, 2025, a Human Rights activist and Convenor of the Siang Indigenous Farmers Forum led a protest against the dam construction in Beging village in which approximately 400 people participated.

title: Celebrations mark reopening of schools in Kannur, Kasaragod
content: The Praveshanolsavam (school opening day celebration) unfolded as a grand cultural event, full of colour, music, and community spirit

title: IAP Kerala comes out with guidelines for students, parents and schools
content: The school authorities and parents should create awareness about substance abuse among students, says IAP functionaries

title: For students of Vellarmala school, a new chapter in life
content: They were welcomed by teachers, accompanied by a band; 25 high school and 11 higher secondary teachers honoured on the occasion

title: CHOs express concern over delay in receiving salaries
content: The CHOs have been on a strike for more than a month demanding payment of pending incentives, an increase in their pay of ₹25,000, regularisation of services of those who completed six years and resumption of PF

title: UDF to step up stir against alleged corruption in Kozhikode Corpn.
content: ‘The recent Vigilance raid on the office and home of the Superintending Engineer is an attempt to save the bigger fish by sacrificing a smaller one’

title: Maharashtra records 873 COVID-19 cases since January, 10 deaths reported
content: Public Health Department confirms surge in infections; genome sequencing and surveillance surveys underway

title: Dilip Ghosh’s absence at Modi, Shah events sparks speculation over internal rift in Bengal BJP
content: Ghosh says he was absent from events because he was not invited to them; talk of division in the ranks continues as the party is yet to pick a president for the State unit

title: Missing Indore man’s body recovered from gorge in Meghalaya; search for wife on
content: Police drone find the body of Raja Raghuvanshi after an eight-day search; couple went missing on May 24

title: Union Home Secretary visits Kuki-Zo relief camps in Manipur, attends security review meeting with Governor
content: The visit comes in the wake of fresh protests and a ‘civil disobedience” call by Meitei groups in the northeastern State

title: India, Paraguay can expand trade with MERCOSUR, says PM Modi
content: New opportunities to be explored in areas such as digital technology, critical minerals, energy, agriculture, healthcare, defence, railways, space, and overall economic partnership

title: U.K. Minister discussed border security with Indian officials in April
content: The U.K Home Office said that, in the past one year, there had been a 45% increase in Indian nationals detained by the immigration authorities, including people who were to be returned

title: Rare migratory bird sighted on Kappad beach five years ago identified as Caspian Gull
content: The Caspian Gull, usually found in Central Asia, visits northwestern India, such as Gujarat, in winter. It was sighted in Goa only once and never again in south India until this time, says Kozhikode-based ornithologist

title: Ponguleti says Revenue Department at the ‘People’s Doorstep’ from Tuesday
content: Revenue Sadassus in which revenue teams, led by Tahsildars, will travel to each revenue village, accepting applications and resolving issues on the site will resume from Tuesday to cover all villages

title: Five from two families killed, two injured in road accidentin East Godavari
content: The incident occurred when a car, in which the seven persons were returning from Kakinada beach, hit a milk tank from behind on Kakinada-Rajahmundry ADB road.

title: Rahul Gandhi to launch campaign to revamp Congress in Madhya Pradesh
content: Rahul will visit the State and hold separate meetings with political affairs committee, the party’s MPs and MLAs in the State, among others

title: Kolkata Police defend arrest of influencer over ‘hate speech’
content: BJP terms action against Sharmistha Panoli as political vendetta; police say arrest in line with legal provisions

title: Pakistan too sends delegations abroad to present its case
content: Teams to call for international “role” in the region, and plead Pakistan’s case for the restoration of Indus Waters Treaty, suspended by India after the Pahalgam terror attack

title: 153 acre green space to come up soon in North Bengaluru
content: An Indira Gandhi Biological Park, Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar Bird Park, Kempegowda Zoo, Saalumarada Thimmakka Arboretum among others are being planned to be set up

title: Three potential Cooper Flagg trades the Mavericks might not immediately reject
content: What if the Mavs traded the draft's top pick? Our NBA insiders offer three enticing offers -- and a verdict.

title: Finals-bound TTU 'left a legacy' in ending OU reign
content: Oklahoma's run of four straight Women's College World Series titles ended when Lauren Allred's walk-off sacrifice fly gave Texas Tech a 3-2 victory in the semifinals Monday night.

title: Sources: Yankees closer Weaver out 4-6 weeks
content: New York Yankees closer Luke Weaver is expected to miss at least four weeks because of a hamstring injury, sources told ESPN's Jeff Passan on Monday.

title: Trout adds to hot return, hits 454-foot HR in win
content: Trout had three more hits on Monday night, including a 454-foot homer that was the longest at Fenway Park this year, in the Angels' 7-6 victory over the Red Sox.

title: Young rallies to clinch U.S. Open spot in playoff
content: Cameron Young birdied three of his last four holes Monday to get into a 5-for-1 playoff and then made a 12-foot birdie to earn his spot in the U.S. Open.

title: Tigers' Carpenter has 'special' 3-HR night in rout
content: Detroit Tigers designated hitter Kerry Carpenter smashed three home runs against the White Sox on Monday night, becoming the first Tiger to accomplish that feat since Victor Martinez in 2016.

title: Homa lugs bag for 36 but misses U.S. Open field
content: Max Homa stood out more than usual Monday in a U.S. Open qualifier filled with PGA Tour players. He was the only one carrying his own bag.

title: Deion rips 'foolish' reports on Shedeur draft prep
content: Deion Sanders says he was "hurt" by reports that his son Shedeur Sanders was unprepared during predraft meetings with NFL teams, but he also isn't buying the validity of them, either.

title: Police: Overseas bettor behind McCullers threats
content: An intoxicated bettor located overseas was behind social media threats directed last month at Houston Astros pitcher Lance McCullers Jr. and his family, according to Houston police.

title: 🔍 Examining if the 'Madden curse' is reality
content: The alleged curse on players who feature on the cover of the iconic NFL game is well known, but has it actually had merit over the past decade?

title: 'I can't go on': The moment a 14-year-old Mike Tyson nearly quit in the ring
content: Mark Kriegel's excerpt from "Baddest Man: The Making of Mike Tyson" looks at the fights of a 14-year-old Tyson.

title: SGA, Haliburton lead Thunder, Pacers to surprise finals
content: The 2025 NBA Finals are here! Our NBA insiders break down everything you need to know ahead of this Pacers-Thunder championship showdown.

title: Three things this East finals run showed the Knicks
content: The Knicks' breakthrough postseason ended in the East finals, but there is plenty to build on in Gotham.

title: Eagles RB Saquon Barkley leaps onto Madden 26 cover
content: Eagles running back Saquon Barkley and his legendary reverse hurdle will be featured on the cover of Madden NFL 26.

title: With Bryce Huff trade, 49ers continue remaking defense in Robert Saleh's image
content: If Saleh can jump-start Huff back closer to his 2023 levels, the Niners will have options to create havoc up front.

title: Did the 49ers or Eagles win the Bryce Huff deal? We graded the trade
content: The 49ers are taking a chance on Huff, who disappointed in his only season in Philly. Did they give up too much?

title: Sports betting isn't legal in all 50 states ... or is it?
content: A dispute between gambling regulators and an upstart company is testing what is a sports bet and what is not.

title: How Liam Coen went from UMass record holder to Jaguars coach
content: The Jaguars' first-year head coach has learned from Mark Whipple, Sean McVay and his dad. Now, he's building his own team.

title: Panthers-Oilers II: Key stats to know for the 2025 Stanley Cup Final
content: For the second consecutive season, it's Florida-Edmonton. Here's what you need to know before Game 1.

title: Florida, Houston rise in our men's NCAA top 25 after NBA draft withdrawal deadline
content: Did the Gators or Cougars do enough to earn No. 1? How the latest key offseason date shifted our projections.

title: How to quantify this NBA playoffs' growing trend
content: Don't be surprised to see a major comeback in the Finals because nobody has mastered the art like the Pacers.

title: Champions League win accomplished Qatar's PSG mission. Now what?
content: PSG's victory in Saturday's UEFA Champions League means that their Qatari owners have finally summited club football. Where do they go from here?

title: Man United's Bruno Fernandes dilemma: A future-defining decision
content: United are at a fork in the road with their captain. Do they take the money from Al Hilal, or keep their talisman?

title: Will anyone fill Nadal's beloved shoes at the French Open?
content: Nadal has left an indelible mark on the French Open -- but Swiatek, Alcaraz and others may be able to carry on the legacy.

title: Stanley Cup Final odds: McDavid is Conn Smythe fave in Panthers rematch
content: Top ways to bet the series and props for the Stanley Cup Final between the Florida Panthers and Edmonton Oilers.

title: Plant vs. Charlo next? Is Canelo the ultimate goal for the winner?
content: Andreas Hale shares his thoughts on what should be next for both fighters after sharing the same boxing card on Saturday.

title: Has Verstappen's Spanish GP tantrum cost him F1 title shot?
content: Max Verstappen is already on the back foot in the F1 title fight. His Spain outburst didn't help his cause.

title: Waiver wire: Add Royals' Caglianone for power potential
content: Tristan H. Cockcroft outlines who should be claimed off the waiver wire, including potential slugger Jac Caglianone, and who should be dropped from fantasy rosters.

title: Messi a factor as Rodríguez weighs club future
content: Club América's Brian Rodríguez admitted that the possibility of featuring alongside Lionel Messi and Luis Suárez at Inter Miami CF plays a role in his decision-making process as he considers a move away from the Liga MX team.

title: 2nd-tier Roots hire ex-U.S. star Feilhaber as coach
content: Former U.S. national team midfielder Benny Feilhaber was hired Monday as coach of the Oakland Roots of the United Soccer League's second-tier Championship.

title: Messi back with Argentina after 7-month layoff
content: Argentina captain Lionel Messi has rejoined the national team for training on Monday after a seven-month break ahead of their upcoming Conmebol World Cup qualifying matches.

title: Source: USWNT's Albert leaving PSG for Lyonnes
content: United States midfielder Korbin Albert has agreed to terms to join eight-time European champions OL Lyonnes on a free transfer, a source with knowledge of the deal confirmed to ESPN.

title: Reynolds' Wrexham interpreter to receive honor
content: Maxime Hughes, the Welsh interpreter for Wrexham owners Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney, has been awarded one of Wales' top honours.

title: Sanchez's Cruz Azul future in doubt after CCC win
content: Cruz Azul head coach Vicente Sanchez celebrated the team's 5-0 triumph over the Vancouver Whitecaps to win the 2025 Concacaf Champions Cup before adding his future with the Liga MX club remains in question.

title: Madrid's Huijsen wants to be like Sergio Ramos
content: Real Madrid's new signing Dean Huijsen has said he wants "to be like Sergio Ramos," praising the former Madrid captain as his "idol."

title: MLS Power Rankings: Messi, Suárez help Miami surge up the list
content: With nine goals in two games, it's official: Inter Miami are back! Just how far have Messi & Co. jumped up ESPN's MLS Power Rankings?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Inter to offer Højlund an escape from Man United
content: Rasmus Højlund looks set to leave Man United, with Inter Milan keen to bring the striker back to Serie A. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Shoe Controversy Entangles Rahul Gandhi During 1-Day Visit To Bhopal
content: On a day meant to focus on party rebuilding, Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi's one-day visit to Bhopal took a controversial turn, not over what he said, but what he wore.

title: Active Covid Cases Cross 4,000 Mark, 5 Deaths In Last 24 Hours
content: India's active COVID-19 cases have crossed the 4,000 mark, with Kerala remaining the most affected state followed by Maharashtra, Gujarat, and Delhi, according to the Union Health Ministry data released on Tuesday.

title: Op Sindoor: Pak Dossier Shows India Struck More Targets Than Revealed
content: India struck more Pakistan targets during Operation Sindoor than our forces acknowledged, an official dossier in Pakistan has revealed.

title: "Won't Permit Anyone To...": 5 Observations Court Made In Kamal Haasan Case
content: The Karnataka High Court on Tuesday warned Kamal Haasan that he cannot use his right to speech "to hurt sentiments", days after the Tamil Nadu actor-politician sparked a huge row with his remark that the Kannada language was "born out of Tamil".

title: 6 Dead In Mysterious Animal Attack In Madhya Pradesh, Despite Rabies Vaccine
content: It all began on the night of May 5 between 1 am and 5 am, when 17 residents of the village were attacked in their sleep.

title: 3 J&K Government Employees Sacked, Jailed For Alleged Terror Links
content: Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha has sacked three government employees over terror links, sources said. The sacked employees were allegedly working for Pakistan-based terror groups, Lashkar-e-Taiba and Hizb-ul-Mujahideen, they added.

title: Pak Politician Backs Pahalgam Mastermind, Shares Stage With LeT Chief's Son
content: In what could be seen as yet another evidence of Islamabad fostering terrorism on its land, a prominent Pakistani politician was seen sharing the stage with the leadership of UN-proscribed terror group Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT).

title: On CCTV, US Babysitter Thrashes Children, Uses Horror Costumes To Scare Them
content: In the footage, she can be heard complaining that the two elder children, four and six years old, had not cleaned their room.

title: Hundreds Of Kashmiri Pandits Gather At Annual J&K Mela Under Tight Security
content: Hundreds of Kashmiri Pandits have gathered at Tulmulla in Jammu and Kashmir's Ganderbal district to participate in the annual Kheer Bhawani Mela, an age-old festival symbolising Kashmir's rich cultural and spiritual heritage.

title: India Ramps Up Heat On Turkey, Mumbai Civic Body Junks Key Tender
content: The Mumbai civic body has scrapped a key tender to buy beach safety equipment from a Turkish company as the government continues to ramp up heat on Turkey for siding with Pakistan during Operation Sindoor.

title: Punjab Man Arrested For Sharing Army Details During Op Sindoor With Pak
content: The accused was allegedly in contact with Pakistan's intelligence agency Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI) and also received money for passing on sensitive information, the police said.

title: "I Was Frustrated...": Australian Mushroom Murderer Breaks Down In Court
content: The woman, Erin Patterson is accused of serving beef wellington to the three deceased with lethal mushroom contents. She denies this claim however.

title: Pakistani Teen Influencer Shot Dead At Home, Cops Suspect Dishonour Killing
content: Sana Yousaf, a popular TikTok content creator from Upper Chitral with nearly 5 lakh followers on Instagram, was reportedly killed at close range by a relative.

title: Centre Notifies New Reservation Rules For Ladakh, 85% Jobs For Locals
content: The government on Tuesday introduced new reservation and domicile rules for the Union Territory of Ladakh, reserving 85 per cent jobs for locals and one-third of the total number of seats in the Ladakh Autonomous Hill Development Councils for women.

title: India-US Trade Deal May Finalise By Next Month, US Congressman Tells NDTV
content: India can become one of the first countries to get into an interim trade agreement with the United States, which could be finalised by next month.

title: "We Have Enormous Respect But...": Shashi Tharoor On Trump's India-Pak Ceasefire Claim
content: US President Trump has repeatedly claimed that he played a key role in facilitating the India-Pakistan ceasefire.

title: Study Shows Gen Z Parents Don't Want To Read To Their Children
content: A HarperCollins UK report said that only 40 per cent of parents say reading to their children is fun.

title: Khan Sir's Viral Exchange With Tejashwi Yadav On His Low-Key Wedding
content: Khan Sir's wedding reception drew in an elite gathering of political leaders, including Bihar Governor Arif Mohammad Khan, Deputy Chief Minister Samrat Chaudhary, and Leader of Opposition Tejashwi Yadav.

title: In Canada Lake, Robot Learns To Mine Without Disrupting Marine Life
content: Three robotic arms extended under the water in a Canadian lake, delicately selecting pebbles from the bed, before storing them back inside the machine. The robot was made by Impossible Metals, a company founded in California in 2020.

title: MK Stalin's "Scared" Swipe As Tamil Nadu Governor Clears 2 Bills
content: Nearly two months after a landmark Supreme Court verdict pulled him up for blocking Bills passed by the Assembly, Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi today cleared two Bills, a month after the House passed them

title: Protests at Idukki school over cancellation of English medium division
